field.label: Mode
field.help: Proxy ARP and other type Virtual IPs cannot be bound to by anything running on the firewall, such as IPsec, OpenVPN, etc. Use a CARP or IP Alias type address for these cases.

field.label: Network / Address
field.help: Provide an address and subnet to use. (e.g 192.168.0.1/24)

field.label: Gateway
field.help: For some interface types a gateway is required to configure an IP Alias (ppp/pppoe/tun), leave this field empty for all other interface types.

field.label: Peer (ipv4)
field.help: Destination address to use when announcing, defaults to multicast, but can be configured as unicast address when multicast can not be used (for example with cloud providers)

field.label: Peer (ipv6)
field.help: Destination address to use when announcing, defaults to multicast, but can be configured as unicast address when multicast can not be used (for example with cloud providers)

field.label: Disable Expansion
field.help: Disable expansion of this entry into IPs on NAT lists (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24 expands to 256 entries.

field.label: Deny service binding
field.help: Assigning services to the virtual IP's interface will automatically include this address. Check to prevent binding to this address instead.

field.label: VHID Group
field.help: Enter the VHID group that the machines will share.

field.label: advbase
field.help: Specifies the base of the advertisement interval in seconds. The acceptable values are 1 to 255.

field.label: advskew
field.help: Specifies the skew to add to the base advertisement interval to make one host advertise slower than another host. It is specified in 1/256 of seconds. The acceptable values are 0 to 254.

field.label: No XMLRPC Sync
field.help: Exclude this item from the HA synchronization process. An already existing item with the same UUID on the synchronization target will not be altered or deleted as long as this is active. This option can be helpful when using Unicast CARP. After the initial synchronization, enable this option and adjust the Unicast IPs on the backup firewall. Additional IP aliases in the same VHID group can now be synced without overwriting their parent CARP VIP.

field.label: Description
field.help: You may enter a description here for your reference (not parsed).
